function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited availability and maintenance of HVAC systems in resource-limited settings, and neglect in resource-rich settings, can lead to ineffective room air disinfection.","Impact":"Increased risk of transmission of airborne infections such as TB.","Mitigation":"Regular maintenance of HVAC systems, investment in effective room air disinfection methods, and promotion of natural ventilation.","Technologies":"Regular HVAC maintenance, effective room air disinfection technologies, and natural ventilation strategies.","People":"People in resource-limited settings and resource-rich settings, especially those at risk of airborne infections such as TB.","Owner":"Health organizations, building maintenance professionals, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Limitations of natural ventilation due to building design, sub-optimal practice, closed windows, and variable wind direction and speed.","Impact":"Reduced effectiveness in reducing the risk of airborne infections, such as TB, and potential increase in airborne infection risk.","Mitigation":"Improvement of building design for natural ventilation, promotion of open windows, and addressing the limitations of natural ventilation through alternative strategies.","Technologies":"Building design improvements for natural ventilation, airflow control systems, and air quality monitoring technologies.","People":"Building designers, architects, and occupants of buildings.","Owner":"Architectural firms, building management companies, and individuals."},{"Description":"Rise in rebreathed air fraction (RAF) due to closing windows and using ductless air conditioning, leading to increased risk of airborne infection.","Impact":"Doubling of RAF and increased risk of airborne infection within a short time.","Mitigation":"Promotion of proper ventilation strategies, avoidance of closed windows and ductless air conditioning, and monitoring of indoor air quality.","Technologies":"Ventilation management systems, indoor air quality monitors, and ventilation-friendly air conditioning systems.","People":"Occupants of buildings using ductless air conditioning and closed windows.","Owner":"Building management companies, HVAC system manufacturers, and government agencies."}]}
